patterns follow me on social media this is a great beginner pattern for anyone who is just learning to knit for a number of reasons it s a great way to practice basic stitches that you need to know in order to knit most things i ve added scannable qr codes to how-to videos at the end of this publication if you need help with any of the stitches take a photo of the square with your phone or tablet and click the link that pops up it will take you right to the video another bonus to making a dishcloth even if it doesn t turn out perfectly it s a dishcloth you can still use it the dishcloth itself is knit along the diagonal like how tvs are measured you can make it as big as you want but i find 45 to 50 stitches makes for a good sized cloth make a lesser number of stitches to make a coaster anywhere from 23 to 27 stitches total would make a good size if you would like it larger you will need to buy more balls of yarn make sure that your lot numbers on the balls you select are the same or else the colours may be off things you need size 8 us 5 mm knitting needles 1 3/4 oz 50g ball of 100% cotton worsted weight yarn tapestry needle page 3 of 9 take a photo of this square for free knitting patterns on my website the pattern cast on 3 row 1 knit row 2 knit row 3 k1 yo knit to end of row repeat this row until there are 48 stitches on your needle next row k1 yo k2tog k to last 4 stitches k2tog k2 repeat this row until there are 6 stitches remaining next row k1 yo k2tog twice k1 next row k1 k2tog twice cast off work in ends page 4 of 9 abbreviations k - knit p - purl k2tog knit 2 together yo - yarn over when doing a yo for a knit stitch pull your yarn forward and knit the next stitch as you normally would if you are uncertain how to do any stitch i have complete how-to videos that will show you how to do it page 5 of 9 hints and tips you can make variations of this basic pattern by making wider
